question.body: Which of the following is not a hormone involved in regulating both the male and female reproductive systems?

response.feedback: Incorrect. GnRH stands for gonadotropin releasing hormone which stimulates both FSH and LH and regulates both gonads.
Incorrect. FSH stands for follicle stimulating hormone and it regulates both gonads.
Incorrect. LH stands for luteinizing hormone and it regulates both gonads, and is sometimes called ICSH in males.
Correct. PRH stands for prolactin releasing hormone and it is active in females only; although males produce prolactin, it is thought to be stress regulated and its function is not well understood.
